intro: Lasianthus kilimandscharicus subsp. glabrescens, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the East African mountains. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at elevations above 2,500 meters. It is notable for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions, including strong winds and low temperatures. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
